alert.note: Alert for Ottawa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 13 at 6:27AM CST until January 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory this morning, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 5 below zero. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch on Sunday, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches possible. * WHERE...Ottawa County. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST today. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Tuesday morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions Sunday. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
